title: Giannis is on a path for greatness
text:
Code
library(tidyverse)
library(cowplot)
library(gt)
library(ggrepel)
library(scales)

allplayers <- read_csv("allplayers.csv")

ws <- read_csv("winshares.csv")

mj <- allplayers %>% filter(Player == "Michael Jordan")
mj2 <- mj %>% filter(Season == 1997)

lbj <- allplayers %>% filter(Player == "LeBron James")
lbj2 <- lbj %>% filter(Season == 2008)

ga <- allplayers %>% filter(Player == "Giannis Antetokounmpo")
ga2 <- ga %>% filter(Season == 2016)


ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data=allplayers, aes(x=Season, y=PTS), color="grey") +
  geom_point(data=allplayers, aes(x=Season, y=PTS), color="grey")+ 
  geom_line(data=mj, aes(x=Season, y=PTS), color="red") +
  geom_point(data=mj, aes(x=Season, y=PTS), color="red") + 
  geom_line(data=ga, aes(x=Season, y=PTS), color="dark green") +
  geom_point(data=ga, aes(x=Season, y=PTS), color="dark green") +
  geom_line(data=lbj, aes(x=Season, y=PTS), color="gold") +
  geom_point(data=lbj, aes(x=Season, y=PTS), color="gold")+  
  geom_text_repel(
    data=mj2, 
    aes(x=Season, y=PTS, label=Player)
  ) +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=lbj2, 
    aes(x=Season, y=PTS, label=Player)
  ) + 
  geom_text_repel(
    data=ga2, 
    aes(x=Season, y=PTS, label=Player)
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous() +
  theme_minimal() + 
  labs(
    x="Season", 
    y="Points Scored Per Year", 
    title="New King in Town?", 
    subtitle="The Greak Freak has dethroned LeBron as the league's best player.", 
    caption="Source: NBA-Reference | By: Peter Rice"
    )





Barring injury, Giannis is on a trajectory to become one of the league’s best of all time. Winning is what matters most, so we need to see if his scoring and stats help his team win as much as other great players have.


Code
   ws2 <- ws %>% top_n(11,`WS/48` ) 

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=ws2, aes(x=reorder(Player, `WS/48`), weight=`WS/48`), color = "blue") +
  coord_flip() +
theme_minimal() + 
  labs( x= "Player",
    y="Playoff Win Shares Per 48 Minutes", 
    title="Winningest Playoff Players", 
    subtitle="Giannis is both accumulating statistics and winning when it matters.", 
    caption="Source: NBA-Reference | By: Peter Rice"
    )





Efficiency is also key when having a prolonged career where you are the primary option. Giannis is a much worse shooter than both Jordan and especially LeBron, but is able to make up the difference by how dominant he is inside the restricted area.


Code
bar1 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=mj2, aes(x=reorder(Player, `2P%`), weight=`2P%`), fill="red") + 
  labs(title="Close Three-Way Race", subtitle = "",  x="", y="Effective-Shooting", caption = "") + 
  theme_minimal()  + 
  theme(
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )
 

bar2 <- ggplot() + 
  
  geom_bar(data=ga2, aes(x=reorder(Player, `2P%`), weight=`2P%`), fill= "dark green")  + 
  labs(title="Close Three-Way Race", subtitle = "",  x="", y="Effective-Shooting", caption = "") + 
  theme_minimal()  + 
  theme(
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 
bar3 <- ggplot() + 
  
  geom_bar(data=lbj2, aes(x=reorder(Player, `2P%`), weight=`2P%`), fill="gold")  + 
  labs(title="Close Three-Way Race", subtitle = "",  x="", y="Effective-Shooting", caption = "") + 
  theme_minimal()  + 
  theme(
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 
  

plot_grid(bar1, bar2, bar3)

title: Russell Wilson Isn’t Living Up to the Hype
text:
However, things have not gone as planned.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)
library(ggrepel)
library(scales)

qbs <- read_csv("QB - Sheet1.csv")

qb1 <- qbs %>% filter( G > 4, `Cmp%` >43, TD> 3)

qb2 <- qb1 %>% top_n(4, TD) 

russ <- qb1 %>% filter(Player == "Russell Wilson")

ggplot() +
geom_point(data=qb1, aes(x=TD, y=`Cmp%`, color="red")) +
geom_point(data=qb1, aes(x=TD, y=`Cmp%`)) + 
  geom_text_repel(data=russ, aes(x=TD, y=`Cmp%`, label=Player))+
geom_smooth(data=qb1, aes(x=TD, y=`Cmp%`), method="lm") +
geom_point(data=qb1, aes(x=TD, y=`Cmp%`, color="blue"))+ geom_text_repel(data=qb2, aes(x=TD, y=`Cmp%`, label=Player))+
labs(x = "Touchdowns Thrown", y = "Completion %",
title = "Best Quarterbacks Through Week 8",
subtitle = "Wilson's performance through eight games doesn't compare to what other stars are producing.",
caption = "Source: Football-Reference.com | By Peter Rice") +
theme_minimal() + theme(
plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
axis.title = element_text(size = 12),
axis.text = element_text(size = 10, color = "black"), 
legend.position = "none"
) 





Russ and the Broncos stand at 3-5 entering their bye week. The underwhelming start cannot be attributed to the defense, who has allowed the second-fewest points in the NFL this season. The offense, meanwhile, has struggled mightily with their new Signal-Caller. Part of the blame is on first-time head coach Nathaniel Hackett who was brought in for his offensive mindset, but Russell was ready to prove he could lead a new team and hasn’t lived up to the task.


Code
qb4 <- qb1  %>% 
  select(Player, TD, Int, `Cmp%`) %>%
  group_by(Player) %>%
  summarize(
    TD,
    Int,
    `Cmp%`
  ) %>%
  select(Player, 
         TD,
         Int,
         `Cmp%` ) %>%
  arrange(desc(TD))

top10 <-  qb4 %>% top_n(10, wt= TD)
russ2 <- qb4 %>% filter(Player == "Russell Wilson")
top10plus <- bind_rows(top10, russ2)

top10plus%>% gt()%>% 
  cols_label(
    Int = "Interceptions",
    TD = "Touchdowns" ,
    `Cmp%` = "Completion %"
  ) %>%  
tab_header(
    title = "Bottom of the Barrel",
    subtitle = "Russ isn't putting up big numbers, and also has one of the lowest completion percentages in the NFL."
  ) %>% tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) %>% tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) %>%
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Peter Rice  |  **Source:** Football-Reference ")
  ) %>%
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=13)
     )
   ) %>%
  opt_row_striping() %>% 
  opt_table_lines("none")%>%
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "#002244"),
      cell_text(color = "#FB4F14")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Player == "Russell Wilson")
  ) %>% 
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "green", weight = "normal"),
    locations = cells_body(
      columns = c(`Cmp%`),
      rows = `Cmp%` > 72
    )
   ) %>% 
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "green", weight = "normal"),
    locations = cells_body(
      columns = c(Int),
      rows = Int <3

   )%>% 
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "green", weight = "normal"),

He will need to improve his play regardless, but his teams in the past consistently made deep playoff runs even when he was playing sub-par. Wilson has another great defense and suitable weapons at his side, so is it possible for him and the Broncos to turn it around?


Code
mrunl <- read_csv("mrunl - Sheet1.csv")
mrunl2 <- read_csv("mrunl2 - Sheet1.csv") 

ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data=mrunl2, aes(x=Year, y=TD), color="#FB4F14") +
  geom_point(data=mrunl2, aes(x=Year, y=TD), color="#002244") +
labs(x = "Year", y = "Passing Touchdowns",
title = "Russell Wilson's Career Arc",
subtitle = "Unless there is a dramatic turnaround, this will be his worst statistical season yet",
caption = "Source: Pro-Football-Reference.com | By Peter Rice", legend.position = "none") +
theme_minimal() + theme(
plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
axis.title = element_text(size = 12),
axis.text = element_text(size = 10, color = "black") 
) +
  geom_text(aes(x=2014, y=18, label="Super Bowl Victory"), color="black") +
  geom_text(aes(x=2020.64, y=12.75, label="Predicted Touchdowns"), color="#002244") +
  geom_point(aes(x=2022, y=14), color="#002244") 





As a career-low season is looming for Wilson, it’s unlikely for the Broncos to make any postseason noise if they make it at all. The organization echoed this belief on the trade deadline when they dealt away talented pass-rusher Bradley Chubb to the Dolphins for Chase Edmonds and a first-round pick in next year’s draft.
With 9 games remaining in the regular season, Russell and the Broncos have an uphill battle to avoid a seventh consecutive season missing the playoffs and their sixth straight losing season.
